website_summaries.verdict: This tripod bag offers an excellent choice for novice and expert photographers alike.
pros: Includes a spacious zippered interior pocket
Bag's interior is equipped with foam padding to help you safeguard your tripod and other camera accessories
Comes with carrying strap handles that help you take the bag just about anywhere
Shoulder strap is simple to remove as needed
More affordable than similar tripod bags

customer_reviews.title: Fit and finish is excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tripod bag. Fit and finish is exactly what I was looking for. Able to hold my Induro CLT303L carbon fiber with ease. This is an almost 6-foot tripod with the center column retracted but it folds down to 27 inches. I bought the 70cm and the fit is snug with a 6” slack, which I love. There’s nothing worse than lugging along a tripod whose bag has too much room to spare. The bag has tie-downs inside to keep the tripod in place and has a net pouch for storage. Very secure. I’m happy I found this on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Hey It's Joel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: An outstanding value for the dollar. Is generously sized within given measurements. Has premium hardware, internal no-spill ties, and a modest mini zipper pocket on the inside. Would have loved a bit more wall padding; however, I decided to use it with a lighter synthetic tri-pod and switched out my heavier case for a more sturdy and heavier metal tri-pod. Is an excellent product for my lighter tri-pod and will work well with the heavier one, any day. The strap and shoulder pad is better on this one than my more expensive carry case. Am a bit spoiled with another discontinued product procured on sale about a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: I am using the 55cm bag for a Really Right Stuff TFC-14 tripod and an attached Really Right Stuff BH-30 ball head. The bag fits like a glove, without being too tight. Given that this was the cheapest bag I could find, I'm frankly surprised by it's high quality. The fabric material feels nice in the hand, the zipper is very smooth, and the padding is generous without being bulky. The included shoulder strap seems adequate. But again, and most important, my particular RRS combo fits nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this bag for transporting my Elk antenna. It is very nicely constructed. The outer shell appears durable. The zipper mechanism is very nice. Padding is ample. There are tie down straps inside to minimize jiggling. The shoulder is also great. And, there is a small zippered pocket inside. The bag was thoughtfully designed and I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anchor

customer_reviews.title: excellent bag that fits perfectly my Really Right Stuff TVC-24L tripod
customer_reviews.text: This bag fits perfectly my Really Right Stuff TVC-24L tripod with an RRS BH-40 ball head installed, for a fraction of the cost of the OEM RRS bag. The bag seems to be strong, built with high-quality and durable materials. It has an inside zippered pocket that is great to carry the set of hex keys that come with the tripod. Will update this review after I test this bag in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Great value for solid product
customer_reviews.text: I can't stand paying ridiculous amounts of $$$ for a simple tripod bag. I ordered the 90cm case to hold my large Manfrotto tripod with RRS ball head attached - I still have about 6-7" left to spare, so the smaller size would likely have been optimal. Thick padding, double stitching, all metal zippers and pulls. Good, solid quality for a sane price. Couldn't recommend more highly.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag for a good price. I sampled 3-4 bags like this for a client's field kit. Extra handy are the accurate sizing dimensions and it is available in increments of 5cm (~2in). So it was the easiest to be certain of which to order. It's not the lightest or fanciest, but the materials feel sturdy where I think they should be (zipper and fabric). All sides are padded but the padding doesn't go all the way to the corners at either end so hard pointy corner bits might not be protected where it's more important.
customer_reviews.author: Ted G

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly matches advertising
customer_reviews.text: Was tired of carrying my tripod with jury-rigged straps. This case was available in many sizes and the one I selected, based on the dimensions of the tripod, worked out perfectly. It is comfortable to carry, has straps inside to secure the tripod while enclosed, and seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Frommelt

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Native American Flute
customer_reviews.text: I know its not meant for it but this works great for my flute. I bought the 29 inch and it fits my 28 inch bass flute perfectly. I'm getting several other sizes for my smaller flutes. This is simple slightly padded folds up when not in use. Pretty rugged exterior soft enough interior. I like it
customer_reviews.author: CDA

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag For Smaller Camera Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for holding two Monopods, counterweights, tripod base and my Theta V 360 Camera. It is well padded and consolidates my smaller equipment into one bag. It has an internal zipped pouch to hold the smallest items.
customer_reviews.author: CaseyG

customer_reviews.title: Great Case for my Tripod
customer_reviews.text: This case is true to its advertised measurements, is very sturdy, and seems to be good quality. I trust it to protect my camera tripod during transit and it makes carrying my tripod much more convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Organ Grinder

customer_reviews.title: Robust and cost efficient
customer_reviews.text: This tripod bag is totally worth the money. Fits in my tripod nice and well. Highly recommended if you’re looking for a robust tripod bag within budget. I also throw in my iPhone tripod into it along with the big sun pak one. It all fits in nice. Comes with padded handles and a sling.
customer_reviews.author: CorAm

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Heavy duty construction, I use this to carry my Mossberg shockwave 20 gauge shotgun. Fits perfect and an inside pocket to carry extra ammo. Well worth the money. Fast shipping and exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Bad zipper
customer_reviews.text: Had this case for a couple of years. Mostly suits in the closet with my extra tripod in it. Get it out a couple times a year. Last time I got it out, the zipper failed, won't stay zipped. Case looks new, but the zipper is junk. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Booneycrasher

customer_reviews.title: High quality bag!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this, so I can't attest to the long-term durability. But the size is perfect, padding perfect, shape perfect! The workmanship looks great, and the zipper (always a concern) looks heavy duty and likely to hold up well. I've looked at several bags and am very happy I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nebraska Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a MIDI player. It needed to be durable enough for when my kids pick it up, but not for hauling around everywhere. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Protects and carries easily.
customer_reviews.text: Paid $800 for a tripod, need something that would protect my investment. Happy with the padding and quality of the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Candi

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be sorry. Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case. Well built, sturdy, nice heavy zippers, roomy, pocket inside and ties to hold whatever your carrying. I’ll be using it for my drum hardware. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Nice carry bags!
customer_reviews.text: There have been numerous glowing reviews on this product and I agree with every one of them. 5-Star product.
customer_reviews.author: BN Lavender

customer_reviews.title: Problem to return
customer_reviews.text: Wrong size - came from China so it cost more to return than what I wouykld get back. Had I known I would not have bought!!!
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Saskor

customer_reviews.title: I bought the 29.5 size is to store a sound bar
customer_reviews.text: We have a sound bar for our RV and wanted something to store it when traveling. It's nicely cushioned, has a sturdy zipper, and like the fact it's waterproof. It fits the sound bar as well as all of the accessories.
customer_reviews.author: boomer11

customer_reviews.title: Protect Your Equipment In Style
customer_reviews.text: These are fairly pricey but worth the money if you've got an expensive monopod or tripod or both. It's more expensive than many but no doubt the best protection you can buy for your equipment. Much better than anything that would come with the equipment itself and in my case there was no case included so this is a must. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: hoopsjake

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value. After reading some of the other reviews, I was concerned about the thickness of the padding. Well, the padding is very good! I highly recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am using it to store my Tripod and a Monopod. Yes, it is a bit big for compact travel size tripods, but that was expected when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: dipus

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Got the wider bag-fits my tripod and room for my Plein air umbrella-win, win! Not too big and bulky-perfect!
customer_reviews.author: SCarter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tripod Bag in a variety of sizes
customer_reviews.text: affordable, simple, sturdy, and well made tripod bags in a variety of sizes, sturdy zippers, good stitching, discreet and professional appearance at an affordable price
customer_reviews.author: Sam Rohn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality - Fair Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality tripod carrying bag. The stitching is very well done and it should last for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Leaming

customer_reviews.title: Returning
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t fit my tent and the extra pad inside made the bag smaller
customer_reviews.author: Luciana F Marques

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good value, takes quite a while for shipment to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Masashi O.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Got this because my travel tripod came with a flimsy type case. This is more substantial and fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Odessa,MO

customer_reviews.title: It's an excellent tripod bag! Very well padded!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my lighting tripods. 3 tripods fit inside of it. Really good zipper and material. The only thing i didn't like was the metal logo.
customer_reviews.author: Sashea & Ruben

customer_reviews.title: It is ok
customer_reviews.text: This is a tripod bag. I was not expecting too much. I'm not surprised or disappointed. It is good for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and a great deal!  Fits my Manfrotto 190go! great!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing good quality and a great deal! Fits my Manfrotto MT190GOA4TB 190go! great!
customer_reviews.author: serge

customer_reviews.title: nice but small
customer_reviews.text: You can't fit two pro tripods in it, but it is a great bag for one, or for two consumer tripods.
customer_reviews.author: A Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great for flower sticks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my juggling sticks and it works great! Not too big or bulky, but plenty of room for two sets.
customer_reviews.author: Myles Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect case for my Swarovski tripod
customer_reviews.text: Light, good padding and well made. Could not be more happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: The product was unbelievably low quality for the price... laughable
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my large tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Held my large Slik tripod with the head installed. The securing straps were a real plus!
customer_reviews.author: Gayleonthego

customer_reviews.title: Buy this NOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a great deal. Better than I expected at this price. Substantial padding, quality zippers, heavy-duty metal (not plastic) swivel hooks on the shoulder strap – even a nice zippered pocket inside to stash things like mounting plates, hex wrench, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lori JE

customer_reviews.title: Great padded bag for my Velbon DV7000 tripods
customer_reviews.text: Great padded bag for my Velbon DV7000 tripods. My only tiny gripe is the shoulder pad could use some actually padding.
customer_reviews.author: agshoots

customer_reviews.title: Tri Pod case
customer_reviews.text: This is a soft case but it’s what I wanted. My Tri-pod fits perfectly and this if well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Collins

product_meta.title: Tripod Carry Bag Pad Package -Bailuoni Great As A Carrying Case for Your Tripod in Outdoor/Outing Photography Bag (50cm(19.6" × 4.7“)
feature_bullets: Carry and protect your 21.65 inch long tripod or studio kit
Come with a removable shoulder strap
With foam padded interior, quick-release buckles and fast-access hook
Attached carrying strap handles to transport the tripod for your in outdoor / outing photography

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars104 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
